alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:39PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kimball, western Banner, southeastern Goshen and east central Laramie Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 439 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Albin, or 28 miles northwest of Kimball, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Albin and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 391 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
